quizzes.title: History Quiz: Mets and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, rodeo, wrangler. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Oriole made the final out of the 1969 World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davey Johnson

questions.question: Who was not one of the starting outfielders for the Mets in the 1969 World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Hahn

questions.question: The image of a bucking horse and rider is a registered trademark of which state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wyoming

questions.question: Cleon Jones was NL MVP in 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where is the PRCA Wrangler National Finals Rodeo held ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nevada

questions.question: The year 1969 was a championship season for all of these New York teams, except this one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rangers

questions.question: In the U.S. the largest number of rodeos are held on which weekend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4th of July

questions.question: Who was the Mets starting third baseman in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Charles

questions.question: Is the modern bronc horse a true wild horse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which pitcher was not on the Mets staff in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Matlack

questions.question: What are the main animals used in a rodeo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: horses and cattle

questions.question: Who was the winning pitcher in game five of the 1969 World Series, clinching the Series for the Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Koosman

questions.question: In what state is the Sikeston Jaycee Bootheel Rodeo held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missouri

questions.question: How many wins did Tom Seaver accumulate in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 25

questions.question: Who was the Mets manager in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gil Hodges

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Country and Teams
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, icc. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How may periods are there in a regular ice hockey game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Where was the inaugural ICC World Cup final played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lords, London

questions.question: Where was the Cricket World Cup inaugurated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: What hockey team plays in Calgary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flames

questions.question: This Washington Capitals player was the first overall selection in the 2004 NHL Entry Draft.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Ovechkin

questions.question: Which of the following players scored 76 goals in his rookie season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teemu Selänne

questions.question: Which country stood runner-up in the final of the inaugural ICC World Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australia

questions.question: Minor penalties in ice hockey are 2 minutes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which goaltender has the nickname King Henrik?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henrik Lundqvist

questions.question: Which country won the inaugural ICC World Cup of 1975 (aka Prudential Cup 1975)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Indies

questions.question: How many teams are there in the NHL?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 30

questions.question: In ice hockey a goal counts as 2 points.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many goaltenders must a team have on their roster according to the NHL rules?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: How many teams participated in the first ICC World Cup tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: In which of the following events are men and women allowed to compete together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Team Roping

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Home and Season
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, icc, plenty. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ever since the MLBs live ball era, which began in 1920, home runs have become more popular and more abundant. Which of the following is the only decade that has not had a player hit for at least 50 home runs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: Who were the NBA Champions in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Pistons

questions.question: Three of these MLB players have hit a home run in at least 8 consecutive games. Which of the listed players did not accomplish this feat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin Ventura

questions.question: Who was the Man of the Series in the inaugural ICC World Cup of 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none

questions.question: Which of the following MLB teams hit the most home runs in one major league season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 97 Seatle Mariners

questions.question: Name the NBA Champions of 1991.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bulls

questions.question: Which one of the following players hit for more than 40 home runs during any season throughout his MLB career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Dimaggio

questions.question: Which one of the following MLB veterans hit over 20 home runs in a single season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J.T. Snow

questions.question: Who was the winning captain of the inaugural ICC World Cup tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clive Lloyd

questions.question: Which of the following sluggers never hit 50 home runs in a single season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Aaron

questions.question: Plenty of players have hit homers from both sides of the plate, but no one has ever done it in the same inning of a baseball game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which nation was banned from the first Cricket World Cup tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: In 1987, Robin Ventura set the record for most grand slams in one season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which one of the following MLB players has ever hit over 40 or more home runs in a single season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reggie Jackson

questions.question: Three of these MLB players have hit at least 400 home runs in one single decade. Who does not belong to the group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Williams

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Super Bowls
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, field, bills. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Buffalo Bills were the first team to lose four consecutive Super Bowls.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these teams won three Super Bowls during the 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Cowboys

questions.question: The term Super Bowl was coined by Howard Cosell.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Joe Namath did not throw a pass in the entire fourth quarter of Super Bowl III.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Were the Phoenix Suns the 1993 NBA Champions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Who won the NBA Championship in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Houston Rockets

questions.question: Which of these running backs did not rush for 100+ yards in a Super Bowl game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duane Thomas

questions.question: The 1992 NBA Championship was won by this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bulls

questions.question: Who is the first quarterback to start for two different losing Super Bowl teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Craig Morton

questions.question: In 1996, the NBA Championship was won by this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bulls

questions.question: This team won the NBA Championship in 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Antonio Spurs

questions.question: Who is the first coach to win four Super Bowls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Noll

questions.question: This kickers 32-yard field goal won Super Bowl V with five seconds left in the game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim OBrien

questions.question: The National Football League representative won the first four Super Bowls.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which team beat the Patriots in Super Bowl XX?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bears

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Golf and Olympic Games
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, initiative, committee. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Golf has never been played at the Olympic Games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The first modern Olympic Games were held in 1896 in London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which golf course is commonly referred to as the home of golf?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Andrews

questions.question: What do golfers Adam Scott, Greg Norman and Geoff Ogilvy have in common?

options.text: They were all born in Australia.
They have never won majors championships.
They were all born in New Zealand.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were all born in Australia.

questions.question: The Olympic Games are held every 5 years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Plato, the famous philosopher, participated in the Olympics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Turnberrys Ailsa Course hosted the 2009 Open Championship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The five colors on the Olympic represent five of the continents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The International Olympic committee was founded in 1894.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The International Olympic Committee was founded on the initiative of a German pedagogue and historian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The marathon is one of the Olympic events inherited from the ancient Olympic Games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Members of the Russian Olympic team were taken hostage during the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: At the ancient Olympic Games, the winners were rewarded with gold.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Greek goddess Nike is considered a personification of triumph.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Australian golfer Greg Norman has never won a major golf championship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Football and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, maradona, theory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A golf player, on a par 5, hits their drive O.B. (Out of Bounds). What should he/she do after that?

options.text: take a stroke-and-distance penalty and play the ball from the tee again, as stroke 3
take a stroke penalty and drop a new ball from where the original ball entered the O.B. area
replay the stroke without a penalty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: take a stroke-and-distance penalty and play the ball from the tee again, as stroke 3

questions.question: Which American chess player was called The Pride and Sorrow of Chess?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Morphy

questions.question: In what position did football star Romario play throughout his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Striker

questions.question: Is it true that the maximum number of clubs allowed in a golf players bag during a round is 17?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What type of injury put the end of Marco van Bastens career in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ankle injury

questions.question: Of what descent is football player Zinedine Zidane?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Algerian

questions.question: In which of these European football teams hasnt Diego Maradona played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Real Madrid

questions.question: In what football team hasnt Johan Cruyff played throughout his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milan

questions.question: In which football team did Ronaldo de Assis Moreira, known as Ronaldinho, make his European debut in 2001?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris Saint-Germain

questions.question: For what U.S. football team did David Beckham start playing in 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Galaxy

questions.question: Football player Edison Arantes do Nascimento, known as Pele, was nicknamed after which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A football player

questions.question: In theory, a foursome should get around all 18 holes of a golf course in how many hours?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 hours

questions.question: What interesting nickname was given to football player Ronaldo Luis Nazario de Lima, better known simply as Ronaldo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Phenomenon

questions.question: In which U.S. football team has Franz Beckenbauer played between 1977 and 1980, and again in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Cosmos

questions.question: A golf player hits the ball from the tee onto the green and in the hole all in one shot. What is this called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hole-in-one
